page.title: 11Life on a Farm
page.content: We visited Preston East Farm and asked the farmer and his wife some questions.They both liked life on a farm and came from farming families. The farm was over 300 years old,the farmhouse (which was victorian) was the youngest part.The lady who owned the farm had inherited it from her father; Mr and Mrs Willis were tenant farmers. The farm of 285 acres,was one third grass and two thirds corn,and there were 395 sheep looked after by a dog called 'Tom'.If they did not live on a farm they would like to live in the country.They could only go on holiday at certain times of the year,and they have a farm manager whilst they are away.They have a kitchen garden beside the farmhouse,but this is the only hobby they have time for.
